brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose of the study is to look at the safety (what are the side effects) and efficacy (how
      well does it work) of gadobutrol when used for taking images of the brain and spine.  The
      results of the Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) will be compared to the results of images
      taken without contrast (gadobutrol).

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar in Japanese Subjects for CNS Imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects referred for a contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the
             central nervous system based on current clinical symptoms or results of a previous
             imaging procedure

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects with any contraindication to the MRI examination

          -  Subjects with severe renal disease to end stage renal disease

          -  Subjects scheduled or are likely to require a biopsy or any interventional
             therapeutic procedure within 72 (±4) hours after the study MRI

intervention.description: A single bolus injection of gadobutrol 1.0M 0.1mmol/kg body weight.

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label, Phase III Study to Determine the Safety and Efficacy of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar in Japanese Subjects Referred for Contrast-enhanced MRI of the Central Nervous System (CNS)

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.description: Blinded readers evaluate contrast of at maximum 5 lesions  and 4 normal brain structures in scans taken with and without injection of gadobutrol on a 4-point-scale.
primary_outcome.measure: Scores for visualization parameter: degree of contrast enhancement

primary_outcome.description: Blinded readers evaluate border delineation of at maximum 5 lesions and 4 normal brain structures in scans taken with and without injection of gadobutrol on a 4-point-scale.
primary_outcome.measure: Scores for visualization parameter: border delineation

primary_outcome.description: Blinded readers evaluate internal morphology of at maximum 5 lesions and 4 normal structures in scans taken with and without gadobutrol on a 3-point-scale.
primary_outcome.measure: Scores for visualization parameter: internal morphology

primary_outcome.description: Blinded readers determine number of detected lesions in scans with and without gadobutrol.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: An exact match is defined as identical diagnosis given by the blinded reader and the independent standard of truth committee.
secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of exact match of the MRI diagnosis with the final clinical diagnosis

secondary_outcome.description: Blinded readers classify the brain tissue as normal or abnormal based on the MRI sets.
secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity to detect abnormal/normal brain tissue

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage to correctly detect presence and absence of malignant lesions which are derived from the MR diagnosis of  readers when compared with the diagnosis of the independent standard of truth committee.
secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity to detect malignant Central Nervous System(CNS) lesions
Number of participants with treatment emergent adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
